examples: The stars are obscured by the clouds
the big elm tree obscures our view of the valley

definitions.text: reduce a vowel to a neutral one, such as a schwa
make undecipherable or imperceptible by obscuring or concealing
not clearly understood or expressed; ; -Anatole Broyard; - P.A.Sorokin; - John Locke
examples: an impulse to go off and fight certain obscure battles of his own spirit
their descriptions of human behavior become vague, dull, and unclear
vague...forms of speech...have so long passed for mysteries of science

definitions.text: marked by difficulty of style or expression
examples: much that was dark is now quite clear to me
those who do not appreciate Kafka's work say his style is obscure
an unnoticeable cigarette burn on the carpet

definitions.text: remote and separate physically or socially; ; - W.H.Hudson
examples: existed over the centuries as a world apart
preserved because they inhabited a place apart
tiny isolated villages remote from centers of civilization
